snippet: You can follow someone on Twitter and friend them on Facebook, but real friends are people you break bread with.
abstract: You can follow someone on Twitter and friend them on Facebook, but real friends are people you break bread with.
lead_paragraph: Last week, I had dinner at Clay Shirky's house along with a group of journalists and academics, all of whom are very active on the Web. Mr. Shirky is the oft-quoted thinker who wrote "Here Comes Everybody" and "Cognitive Surplus." I have no idea why he was having the dinner or why I was invited, only that it sounded like a fun, smart bunch. We all "know" each other, either through a direct online connection or by digital reputation, but I am more familiar with them as digital avatars than as people.

headline.main: My Dinner With Clay Shirky, and What I Learned About Friendship
